text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with brown butter pineapple corn
muffins so there's a restaurant called
home right around the corner from my
house in san francisco and they have the
best cornbread ever and i'm not sure
exactly what's in it but I'm pretty sure
it's brown butter and some dried
pineapple and of course I could just ask
him but that's no fun so I keep trying
to figure it out myself and this is one
such attempt in muffin form I'm gonna
start with a big handful of dried
sweetened pineapple they sell dried
unsweetened pineapple but you don't want
that this is basically gonna be the
sweetener for the entire muffin recipe
I'm gonna mince that nice and small so
just about like that
so I've about 3/4 of a cup of that I'm
gonna throw a stick of butter in a heavy
saucepan on medium heat and we are gonna
make brown butter which is about the
easiest recipe ever as soon as it melts
and as soon as that foam starts to sort
of bubble and cook then you got to start
paying attention what we're looking for
is a light sort of hazelnut Brown a
light brown not a black not a dark brown
but not too late either something just
about like that okay a light nutty Brown
at that point turn off the gas quickly
throw in your dried pineapple give it a
stir and just let the pineapple steep in
that hot butter for about 20 minutes so
just set that aside
and you can go on to measuring the dry
ingredients alright so in a mixing bowl
I'm going to weigh out my flour I'm
gonna also use some cornmeal of course
so we have flour we have cornmeal we
have salt we have baking soda and I'm
gonna give that a mix with the whisk so
just whisk it around there for about a
minute and you will break up anything
that needs breaking up we're gonna set
the dry ingredients aside and move on
back to the wet all right so we're gonna
transfer the butter and pineapple
mixture that's now cooled down to just
barely warm we're gonna put that in a
mixing bowl we're gonna add our
buttermilk and our eggs alright I'm
gonna take a whisk I'm gonna beat that
together until completely smooth so I'm
gonna take about a minute and then we're
going to combine our wet ingredients
with our dry and it really doesn't
matter for this
recipe at least which you pour into
which I'm gonna pour the wet into the
dry and I'm gonna mix with a whisk until
it's just combined don't be so paranoid
about over mixing just don't keep mixing
it once it's mixed see right there it's
mixed I stopped even though my arm was I
can't give it a couple more turns my
brain was like no it's mixed I'm gonna
line a 12 muffin pan with those paper
muffin liners and or cupcake liners
yes they have little sports icons on
them why because when we bought them we
thought they were flowers I'm gonna give
it a nice spritz with the vegetable
spray because that dried pineapple is so
sweet and sticky these do tend to stick
a little bit to the liner's all right
I'm gonna divide up my batter evenly
between the 12 cups and I just use a
little sorbet scoop make sure they're
all even at the end that's gonna go in a
375 degree oven for about 25 minutes or
until a toothpick or bamboo skewer comes
out clean from the center see that
there's no dough in that if there's
dough on it it's not done
put it back in when they're cool enough
to handle you can remove them from the
pan and let them finish cooling on a
rack who's a good idea and then they're
ready to eat that brown butter gives it
this great nutty aroma and kind of a
background flavor the dry pineapple
gives it a lot of sweetness also gives
us some beautiful texture you'll also
feel those little chewy bits in the
muffin as you bite into it very cool and
then the muffin itself a great
all-purpose perfect with chili great
with soup fantastic with stew type
cornbread has a nice moist grain it'll
break apart it's very tender yet it's
not dry and crumbly like some corn
breads you break it open and they like
crumble in your fingers like dust like a
mummy and one of those old movies all
right remember those and actually no I
couldn't think of a more obscure
reference so anyway if you like
cornbread and you like muffins you will
love these brown butter pineapple corn
bread muffins I hope you give it a try
all the ingredients are on the site as
usual and as always enjoy
